intro: Gallitrichum stereocaulon, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and is typically found in rocky or alpine environments. The plant has a compact growth habit with fleshy, often succulent leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, round pods that contain seeds. Gallitrichum stereocaulon is adapted to harsh, nutrient-poor soils and is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
